questions.question: Which sense is usually strongest in dogs?
questions.aid1: Dogs have up to 300 million scent receptors.
questions.aid2: Their noses are far more sensitive than ours.
questions.lesson: Dogs explore the world mainly through smell. Some work as detection dogs.

questions.question: What sound might a dog make when it’s happy?
questions.aid1: Look at the tail and relaxed body too.
questions.aid2: Dogs don’t purr or hiss like cats.
questions.lesson: Happy dogs often have loose body language and a wagging tail.

questions.question: What is the typical gestation period of a dog?
questions.lesson: Dog gestation is ~63 days, but can vary slightly by breed/individual.

questions.question: Which vitamin is toxic in excess for dogs?
questions.aid2: Excess can cause hypercalcemia and kidney issues.
questions.lesson: Too much Vitamin D can be dangerous for dogs; dosing must be careful.

questions.question: Which parasite is *transmitted by ticks* and can affect dogs?
questions.lesson: Babesiosis can cause anemia in dogs; tick prevention is critical.

questions.question: Which body condition score (BCS) range is generally considered ideal in dogs?
questions.lesson: Most charts consider 4–5/9 ideal; ribs palpable, waist visible.
